definition: ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
lit. to stand like the three legs of a tripod/tripartite confrontation or balance of forces
(honorific) your kind efforts/thanks to your help
Fuding county level city in Ningde 寧德|宁德[Ning2 de2], Fujian
Fuding county level city in Ningde 寧德|宁德[Ning2 de2], Fujian
the Nine Tripod Cauldrons, symbol of state power, dating back to the Xia Dynasty
We are most grateful for your valuable assistance.
one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight

sentences.english: One example is "One word weighs nine Dings".
sentences.chinese: 字面意思呢就是说一句话抵得上九只鼎。

sentences.english: Literally it means one sentence equals nine Dings.
sentences.chinese: 字面意思呢就是说一句话抵得上九只鼎。

sentences.english: I'm going to make a birthday cake for you.
sentences.chinese: 我憨鼎封刮莩钙凤水脯惊正准备给你做个生日蛋糕。

sentences.english: The Simuwu Great Tripod is China's biggest piece of bronze ware.
sentences.chinese: 我国最大的青铜器是司母戊大方鼎。

sentences.english: The Simuwu Rectangle Ding is China's biggest piece of bronze ware.
sentences.chinese: 我国最大的青铜器是司母戊大方鼎。

sentences.english: The eagle tripod is only 36 cm high but has a heroic image.
sentences.chinese: 陶鹰鼎通高只有36厘米，但看上去显得威武而雄壮。

sentences.english: In Chinese culture, the ding is a symbol of power;
sentences.chinese: 在中国的文化中，鼎一直被认为是权力的象征。

sentences.english: I wonder, Han Jia, why ancient people made this heavy bronze cauldron?
sentences.chinese: 可是，韩佳，古代人为什么要造这么重的鼎啊？

sentences.english: This tripod is made of bronze.
To ancient people, Ding cauldrons were symbols of power and status.
sentences.chinese: 古代人认为鼎是权利和身份的象征。

definition: variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous

senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)
